title: So what is Riot doing to improve solo player experience?
body:
I'd honestly like to know.

Because for me it's a very demoralizing experience.

Sometimes I ask myself what bring me back to this game that seems to cause me more grief than joy, I often wonder what it is. Perhaps someday I'll have the strenght to just lay it aside entirely, sure hope I get there soon.

Maybe it is, maybe it's not, I keep hoping something good will happen, but it feels like every ounce of good news has a ton of bad news come with it. Meh... whatever.

I think its mostly just in your head tbh. I never noticed much of a difference from last season.

they did behind the scenes matchmaking improvements so that if you play as a premade you face higher elo solo players, giving solo players an advantage really.

Don't forget my head. It is also there.

So if get a premade on my team as a solo I get punish just for having a premade on my side... can't wait.

Now really, as a solo I don't want this kind of BS, How the fuck does Riot meassure team synergy to guaranteed certain amount of MMR difference will do. In fact with that mych boosting going rampant how can the make this work?.

Fuck that, they know what they have to do.

They have stats that tell them how likely you are to win vs premade players compared to with them, as a solo player, etc. if they can get the likelihood to 50% by offsetting the premade advantage with an elo advantage... what's the problem? 

I honestly think the drama around dynamic queue is mostly garbage. playing ranked as a solo player is the same as it was last year, at least if you aren't high diamond where challenger teams appear or whatever. 

its like how everyone bans zed even though he isn't op lol
You are just ignorant. There many reasons that have been stated and backed here in the forums several times, but if you think everything is in our heads why would anyone try to reason with you?

Because statistics work better the bigger numbers you have. So YEAH, of course over a community of MULTIPLE MILLIONS OF PEOPLE and elos, if you average it all together, solo players have a 50% winrate, and premades have a 50% winrate--sure, that sounds fair. But that doesn't mean jack shit for the average player. Let's say you play less than 30 games a week... that's so few, you can't even get a good number to see if you really are having a good win/loss rate. But that's still a lot of games. In that time, you could be playing top/jg solo, and then get 3/4 man dived in tower, or get your buffs camped. Your premade on your team isn't even paying attention to you, because they're all having a jolly time in their own lanes.

Perhaps you even win that game. It was great, your premade carried you. But how was the solo player's experience? Shitty, right?    Were they able to solo carry the way they might have last season? No. Do they even get to really participate in the game? No. If they do well, do they get accolades? Nope. If they do poorly, is their team likely to treat them nicely? Hell no, their premade is going to flame them up because they can do no wrong.

There is no statistic that can capture the feeling in Bronze/Silver/Gold of seeing plays that you could NEVER hope to get right without voice chat on your team because you're low elo and you all suck ass, but seeing yourself get fucked over by these perfect teleport ganks and 3/4 man tower dives, and as you're sitting with your grey screen, you look over and see that support with teleport, jungle and top are all in the same club...

There's just no statistic that can correctly take that into consideration. It is a statistically unlikely thing to happen--statistically. But that happening once or twice every 30 games can make it FEEL like you're getting shafted, especially when, once again, you could never hope to pull that stuff off, because how do you ping "hey I'm tanking the tower so maybe you can KILL THEM pls"? No pings for that. Or how about "hey, that's warded! Don't gank yet!"? Is there a ping for that? Or maybe, "5 bot lane, push top hard?"

No, I have to go walk up to my tower and type for that to happen, and by then, the opportunity might have been missed. And so even if I could have done it, even if I am as good as them, even then, I can't, because I just do not have time to stop moving/using abilities in a game where milliseconds count.

Low elo players are allowed to have opinions about the game. We are mechanically unskilled with a lack of game knowledge, not newborn idiots that are deaf and blind and can't read club tags or have feelings. Surprise! Bronze/Silver/Gold scrublords can, in fact, feel feelings and think thoughts.

statistics are going to more accurately determine game balance than your whiny feelings. Imagine if they nerfed champions that weren't op or unhealthy at all just because a lot of players didn't like fighting that champ?

it has nothing to do with your rank either, I think you just are blaming something other than yourself because that's what people do.

you are looking at that system in a vacuum outside of any other possible parameters to prove your point is why.

Besides i at least trust that it will be a equal footing competitive environment because Blizzard sticks voice chat into everything even starcraft 2, also it might be harsh but Overwatches skill floor and ceiling for mastery is not massively steep either.
I played though the era where junglers were treated worse then supports and i kept my silence, this dynamic queue non sense however cannot be allowed to fester.

Junglers were never treated worse than supports. It the earlier days of League, supports were dumping all their gold to have an inventory full of wards. So it was basically a 4v4 and 2 people just worrying about entire team vision.
That sure were fun times.

Yes they were at one point for most of a season where the response of oh gods anything but jungle pls was considered normal, just because you don't remember it or were not around when it happened does not mean it didn't happen.

I've been here for 7 years and that means i've been through everything from the start. Doesn't necessarily mean i remember everything that happened because i wasn't interested in all roles. I've transitioned from a mid to support and finally to ADC. Still my most notable role is support.
It stands to reason that i know the woes of my kind very well. Apart from knowing that junglers were very few and far between in way earlier seasons and that the jungle items have been changed almost every season as well, i don't really remember that junglers ever had it as bad as supports.

Some examples would go a long way.

Well i doubt you would remember it at all then since only junglers were affected by it and other roles just did not care since it did not affect them, but it was extremely common during this period for the jungler to be 3-6 levels behind the support and that was considered doing good, and the gold comparison was just as bad.

Yea, that probably happened at some point in early Seasons.
Right now, supports are the least leveled and gold starved champions so i guess that in a way, the problem junglers had in the past has finally reached us.
When i say finally, i mean it's been here for a while. It makes it practically impossible to play another support that is not utility oriented because your damage suffers twofold - you don't have a lot of gold to invest in it and then you're behind in levels, which drops your damage as well.

But i hear from the [Surrender at 20 post](http://www.surrenderat20.net/2016/06/red-post-collectionstate-of-season-mid.html#more), 6.13 patch is supposed to address support XP.
I believe that will help supports by a lot, if they finally be on the same average levels as everyone in the game. As far as supports having bigger gold income, i believe that if they do this, literally anyone could then become a support. That depends on how much gold we're talking about here, but maybe even increasing their average gold slightly wouldn't suddenly make supporting too lucrative to pass up.

This post right here shows you do not understand why people are upset even the slightest. It has nothing to do with players losing games or winning games because of premades. It has ONLY to do with a significant portion of the community who feels that the QUALITY of their gaming experience has been degraded by the addition of DQ regardless of win or loss. This is empirically proven to be true. Even Riot states there are issues they are working on, the fairness of matchmaking has degraded significantly this season. You know this because the average MMR difference of the highest ranked player in a match and the lowest ranked player in a match was about 75-100 in previous seasons. This season it is in the 200-300 range. That is a HUGE jump. This means matches, this season, are 100-200% more volatile on AVERAGE due to the high variance of the skill levels of players involved. For obvious reasons this has degraded the quality of competitive integrity so dramatically that Riot has already limited high level players like myself to 3 man teams and no more 5 man teams. We will no longer be seeing a bunch of Master/Diamond players playing against a full professional team.

My skill range is not the only one affected. ALL skill ranges are affected by the MMR variance in matches to a greater degree this season than in any prior season. Naturally this means the quality of ALL players gaming experiences is LESS than it was in the past. This was the opposite of what Riot intended when they introduced the system in the first place, which is why they are now going about ways to try to resolves some of the unintended issues they caused. Of course, players like myself told them on the boards this would happen 6 months ago when we first heard the news about DQ being launched. But we were ignored. Its kind of a big slap in the face to us. And none of us are pleased about it.

See? Discussion was had here. Discussion that contributes to the direction of the game. Right here, in this last post of yours you managed to contribute something worthwhile and spur actual discussion. Without being offensive or rude or hostile. That is appropriate boards behavior. Please continue to do THIS in the future as this is acceptable. Do not fall into your previous pattern of inappropriate boards behavior as it can, and will, lead to a boards permanent suspension.

Spare me the "spiritual discussions" of yours. I'm not a monk.
I don't feel like the quality of my games has been affected because this fluctuation has always been here, even in SoloQ. Mainly because one person can just ruin your game, let alone a premade. I'm Plat. So i can't be the one who is magically in a place where this doesn't affect me, it probably means it's not such a big issue everyone makes it out to be.

That doesn't mean i don't want anything to change nor that i feel like everything is fine, but that i am willing to wait for the changes. I'm fed up with people who constantly, day after day, littler the boards with the same question. And it's not in the form of a question, they are opening "a discussion" with shit-talking Riot and then demanding that the issue they have the game is addressed pronto.

#If it has been asked and answered, compile it in a single thread and pin it to the top of the boards. If we have already answered some questions, then they should be visible the moment you hit Gameplay or any related boards - the lack of visibility on this issue is why i think boards are nothing but shit.

You don't need to be a monk, you aren't in some magical place, you simply don't pay attention to how it affects you as a player or do not care that it affects you as you believe the affect to be natural. All fine opinions to hold. All fine to express. I would highlight that you mention one player can ruin your game and in the past this most often occurred because of a poor pairing in which a player dramatically less talented and with a much lower MMR got stomped by players who were better than him. This is and always has been my issue with the systems in place, they consistently pair players poorly (to a greater degree now) and are incapable of ranking players appropriately on an individual basis if they take into account no individual skill metrics. No one calls Alex Gordon the best player in baseball just because the Royals won the world series last season, he's not paid like the best ball player, why does League have a system that only rates players based on the performance of the team? This was fine for 5s teams ranked queue in the past but is never going to be a system that functions properly for a queue that allows less than a full team.

> That doesn't mean i don't want anything to change nor that i feel like everything is fine, but that i am willing to wait for the changes. I'm fed up with people who constantly, day after day, littler the boards with the same question. Just because you do not feel as strongly about an issue does not mean that another player who does feel strongly is in the wrong for expressing that opinion, just as you are not wrong for expressing yours in this response. You must allow others to express their opinions as well, whatever they may be. If it is an opinion that aggravates you then you don't have to click the thread. Nothing changes the fact that we are indeed having some valuable discussions on this topic in this thread and in others. That's a positive contribution to the community and other players can perhaps benefit from it down the line. We are performing community service here, all of us, in the hopes that our input can make a difference one way or another.

Sadly Riot does not participate on the boards as much as they could (or some players feel as they should) and so we have some clutter. That's just kind of the way it goes and we all have to deal with it. I too would agree it'd be nice to have some better visibility and much more Rioter interaction on this topic.

In regards to your offensive posts and moderation they have taken no action because I have not spoken with Curator or Keyru about them. You show the ability to participate in a constructive fashion and are not repeating your mistakes from those previous posts. It would appear that merely my admonishment was all that was needed to make you realize you have something worth saying and that you needed to find a more polite and constructive way of saying those things. I don't take that kind of step lightly, it should be reserved for the most egregious repeat offenders and clearly you are not one of them. Your post history says more than enough on that and everyone should be forgiven for a minor transgression made in the heat of a moment. Its not like you do that all day every day to everyone. No real harm, no foul I say. I must say that it is appreciated however that you have chosen to participate in a far more constructive manner and thank you for making that change. Well done.
